profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Thomas M. Williams papers
did.abstract: Correspondence, notes, clippings, photographs, and memorabilia pertaining to Williams' affiliation with Stanford University and Palo Alto Hospital, including syllabi and notes from classes, 1895-96; his World War I service in Scotland; and his family. Also includes guest book from the family cabin, 1937-47, which includes notes and signatures of Herbert Hoover, Lou Henry Hoover, and their children

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Gift of Rhona Williams, 1987-88, Ethel McGiness, 1988, and Fred Glover, 1988.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Thomas M. Williams Papers (SC0191). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Stanford Class of 1897. Williams earned his MD at Columbia College of Physicians and Surgeons in 1901. He was one of Palo Alto's first physicians, establishing his practice there in 1904; he continued a close affiliation with Stanford, serving on its Board of Athletic Control from 1916 to 1928.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, notes, clippings, photographs, and memorabilia pertaining to Williams' affiliation with Stanford University and Palo Alto Hospital, including syllabi and notes from classes, 1895-96; his World War I service in Scotland; and his family. Also includes guest book from the family cabin, 1937-47, which includes notes and signatures of Herbert Hoover, Lou Henry Hoover, and their children

did.unittitle: Papers
Obituaries and other articles
Notes re: Stanford Stadium controversy; press release about Stadium construction, 1921
Correspondence: Mrs. Dora Moody Williams, 7 Nov. 1928, tl.
John Pearce Mitchell luncheon, June 1945
Correspondence: Stanford - Palo Alto Hospital, March 1942
Wooley Camp Association (list of families camping)

Correspondence, 1938-48: letters from Harold and Elsie Heath; Lucy (Allabach) Lichty with photographs of student picnics 1893; Ray Lyman Wilbur; and Arthur and Grace Clark with illustrated map of San Juan Hill neighborhood on Stanford's campus
Christmas cards from Louise Culver, 1943-45 and undated
Christmas cards from Alice Windsor Kimball, 1918-1922
Williams and the Stanford "Indian": typescript excerpt
Emma Rendtorff, "Magic Waters": typescript of play dedicated to Dr. Williams and program, 1918
Russian money, c. 1923
Evolution lecture outlines with class notes by Williams, ca. 1895
Syllabus for History 5a with notes by Williams on reverse, ca. 1895
Syllabus for European Civilization (with bibliographies, excerpts, study questions), 1895/96 year
Correspondence: Mrs. Dora Moody Williams to Auntie Kate (Mrs. William L. Smith), 3 Nov. 1930 (photocopy, the White House letterhead)
Photographs (15): Thomas Williams, family and friends

scopecontent.p: 1. Thomas W. Williams with Norman Scofield
4. Family portrait, from left: Rhona, Dr. Willliams, Mrs. Williams, Elizabeth

7. Williams' office building, downtown Palo Alto

14. Dora Estey Moody Williams in her wedding dress, 1901

did.unittitle: Strattnpeffer Naval Hospital, Scotland: includes photographs, souvenir photo album, postcards and a reminiscence by Edith May Lyon - a nurse who served with Dr. Williams at Strattnpeffer during World War I
Guest book from family cabin, 1937-47
